content:
The colour of the account in the Folder Pane when new messages arrive can be set with css: 

/* folder pane account colour new messages */ .new-messages > .container > .name {   color: red !important;  }


Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, create a new folder named chrome, create a new document in chrome with a text editor, name it userChrome.css, Save as type: All files *.*, copy in the above code, change the colour as desired. Double-click toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets to true in Settings/General/Config. editor, restart TB.

Online css generator

video on how to create a css file (Firefox and TB)
creator: sfhowes

content: Prihláste sa priamo z webu, či vám v gmail nenapísali, že vám zamietli možnost prihlásenia sa, a že prípadný útočník pozná vaše heslo, a že môžete znížiť zabezpečenie a potom že to pôjde. Takže problém môže byť aj vo vyššom zabezpečení na strane google.com. Stáva sa to vtedy, pokiaľ sa použije v krátkom čase pri prístupe k vášmu účtu viac prehliadačov alebo viac IP adries k prihláseniu. „Nedávno jsme zabránili pokusu o přihlášení do tohoto zařízení. Uvedli jste, že jste tento pokus provedli vy. Pro účely zabezpečení se toto zařízení bude po dobu dvou týdnů zobrazovat v seznamu. Zmíněnou událost můžete také prověřit na stránce“ = Preverte či mate vypnuté dvojstupňové overenie: https://myaccount.google.com/security?pli=1#signin a zapnite aj prístup pre menej bezpečné aplikácie: https://www.google.com/settings/security/lesssecureapps = A ešte preverte na webe, či ste si vo svojom účte povolili POP, alebo IMAP prístup: http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/01/12/Gmail_POP3_povoleny.jpg http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/01/12/gmail_IMPAP.jpg
creator: Ansamb

content: Hi, Sorry for your bad experience with your OS. If you use IMAP as an e-mail server type, you should be able to get your messages after installing Thundebird and setting the account again. Let me know if that worked!

content: Hi Steve, I believe the Archive folder/s are the one that are default for the IMAP (such as inbox, sent, trash, etc) which you can't delete.
creator: shopov.bogomil

content: Thank you for your reply... what I do not understand is why I have two folders - "archive" and "archives" - I don't think both of them a standard to IMAP.
creator: tommyzulu

content:
Not sure about that. I believe in the past the Thunderbird created a folder "Archives" (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/archived-messages) as a special IMAP folder and these days is "Archive". I guess this is what was happening.

I see some discussions here: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1801940

creator: davidsk

content:
Hello, Looking at the instructions for the other mail clients, you simply need to make sure your SMTP server is authenticated.

To check that: - Settings - Click on the e-mail address to open the account settings - Scroll down to the Outgoing Server (SMTP) - Click on edit - and from the window that appears ensure that the authentication method is with password or something more advanced.

Let me know if this helped.
creator: shopov.bogomil

creator: davidsk

content: You haven't provided any information on your account, such as your input and output server settings in full. The fact that your smartphone also stopped is a strong indication that the email provider changed the settings, as Thunderbird's settings can have zero impact on your phone. I would have thought they would take a serious interest on hearing that your email stopped on PC and phone. So, give us the info and someone here may have suggestions on whatever was changed.
creator: davidsk
